q: Know yourself and you will win all battles.
h:
“Know yourself and you will win all battles.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Every traveler has a home of his own, and he learns to appreciate it the more from his wandering.
h:
“Every traveler has a home of his own, and he learns to appreciate it the more from his wandering.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Don't let your learning lead to knowledge. Let your learning lead to action.
h:
“Don't let your learning lead to knowledge. Let your learning lead to action.” —
Jim Rohn

q: From morning till night, we should never rely on a single thing.
h:
“From morning till night, we should never rely on a single thing.” —
Huang Po

q: Great leaders are almost always great simplifiers, who can cut through argument, debate and doubt, to offer a solution everybody can understand.
h:
“Great leaders are almost always great simplifiers, who can cut through argument, debate and doubt, to offer a solution everybody can understand.” —
Colin Powell

q: People often say that motivation doesn't last. Well, neither does bathing - that's why we recommend it daily.
h:
“People often say that motivation doesn't last. Well, neither does bathing - that's why we recommend it daily.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: A thing constructed can only be loved after it is constructed; but a thing created is loved before it exists.
h:
“A thing constructed can only be loved after it is constructed; but a thing created is loved before it exists.” —
Charles Dickens

q: We take care of the future best by taking care of the present now.
h:
“We take care of the future best by taking care of the present now.” —
Jon Kabat-Zinn

q: Quality means doing it right when no one is looking.
h:
“Quality means doing it right when no one is looking.” —
Henry Ford

q: I live by letting things happen.
h:
“I live by letting things happen.” —
Dogen

q: I alone cannot change the world, but I can cast a stone across the waters to create many ripples.
h:
“I alone cannot change the world, but I can cast a stone across the waters to create many ripples.” —
Mother Teresa

q: Till it has loved, no man or woman can become itself.
h:
“Till it has loved, no man or woman can become itself.” —
Emily Dickinson

q: All has not been said and never will be.
h:
“All has not been said and never will be.” —
Samuel Beckett

q: There is no way to happiness - happiness is the way.
h:
“There is no way to happiness - happiness is the way.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: The pain of parting is nothing to the joy of meeting again.
h:
“The pain of parting is nothing to the joy of meeting again.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Who wishes to fight must first count the cost.
h:
“Who wishes to fight must first count the cost.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Sometimes you have to lose all you have to find out who you truly are.
h:
“Sometimes you have to lose all you have to find out who you truly are.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.
h:
“The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.” —
Mark Twain

q: The more you feed your mind with positive thoughts, the more you can attract great things into your life.
h:
“The more you feed your mind with positive thoughts, the more you can attract great things into your life.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
h:
“When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.” —
Laozi

q: Nothing is impossible. The word itself says 'I'm possible!'
h:
“Nothing is impossible. The word itself says 'I'm possible!'” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: Peace begins with a smile.
h:
“Peace begins with a smile.” —
Mother Teresa

q: The eye with which I see God is the same eye with which God sees me.
h:
“The eye with which I see God is the same eye with which God sees me.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: The mirror is a worthless invention. The only way to truly see yourself is in the reflection of someone elses. eyes.
h:
“The mirror is a worthless invention. The only way to truly see yourself is in the reflection of someone elses. eyes.” —
Voltaire

q: Opportunity comes when you continually push forward.
h:
“Opportunity comes when you continually push forward.” —
Sonia Ricotti

q: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.
h:
“Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.” —
Thomas Edison

q: The pen is the tongue of the mind.
h:
“The pen is the tongue of the mind. ” —
Miguel de Cervantes

q: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.
h:
“I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.” —
Nelson Mandela

q: Attitude is a little thing that makes a BIG difference.
h:
“Attitude is a little thing that makes a BIG difference.” —
Winston Churchill

q: New beginnings are disguised as painful endings.
h:
“New beginnings are disguised as painful endings.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Judge your success by what you had to give up in order to get it.
h:
“Judge your success by what you had to give up in order to get it.” —
Dalai Lama

q: People acting together as a group can accomplish things which no individual acting alone could ever hope to bring about.
h:
“People acting together as a group can accomplish things which no individual acting alone could ever hope to bring about.” —
Franklin D. Roosevelt

q: To some degree, you control your life by controlling your time.
h:
“To some degree, you control your life by controlling your time.” —
Conrad Hilton

q: You cannot find peace avoiding life.
h:
“You cannot find peace avoiding life.” —
Virginia Woolf

q: Remember that sometimes not getting what you want is a wonderful stroke of luck.
h:
“Remember that sometimes not getting what you want is a wonderful stroke of luck.” —
Dalai Lama

q: If you are depressed, you are living in the past. If you are anxious, you are living in the future. if you are at peace, you are living in the present.
h:
“If you are depressed, you are living in the past. If you are anxious, you are living in the future. if you are at peace, you are living in the present.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Turn off your mind, relax, and float downstream.
h:
“Turn off your mind, relax, and float downstream.” —
John Lennon

q: Throw me to the wolves and I will return leading the pack.
h:
“Throw me to the wolves and I will return leading the pack. ” —
Seneca

q: Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
h:
“Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.” —
George Addair

q: I will not walk backward in life.
h:
“I will not walk backward in life.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: He is richest who is content with the least, for content is the wealth of nature.
h:
“He is richest who is content with the least, for content is the wealth of nature.” —
Socrates

q: Wealth is the product of man's capacity to think.
h:
“Wealth is the product of man's capacity to think.” —
Ayn Rand

q: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
h:
“The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.” —
Mahatma Gandhi

q: Be the change that you want to see in the world.
h:
“Be the change that you want to see in the world.” —
Mahatma Gandhi

q: Unexpressed emotions will never die. They are buried alive and will come forth later in uglier ways.
h:
“Unexpressed emotions will never die. They are buried alive and will come forth later in uglier ways.” —
Sigmund Freud

q: Freeing oneself from words is liberation.
h:
“Freeing oneself from words is liberation. ” —
Bodhidharma

q: The more tranquil a man becomes, the greater is his success, his influence, his power for good. Calmness of mind is one of the beautiful jewels of wisdom.
h:
“The more tranquil a man becomes, the greater is his success, his influence, his power for good. Calmness of mind is one of the beautiful jewels of wisdom.” —
James Allen

q: Forget safety. Live where you fear to live.
h:
“Forget safety. Live where you fear to live.” —
Rumi

q: It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.
h:
“It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one. ” —
George Washington

q: Study logic and math, because once you've mastered them, you won't fear any book.
h:
“Study logic and math, because once you've mastered them, you won't fear any book.” —
Naval Ravikant
